info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 30 at 3:38PM AKST until December 1 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage AK
info.description:
* WHAT...Mixed precipitation. Additional snow accumulations up to one inch and ice accumulations around a light glaze.
* WHERE...Anchorage, Lower Matanuska Valley, and Southern Susitna Valley.
* WHEN...Until 6 AM AKST Monday.
* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning commute.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A wintry mix of snow, freezing rain and sleet across Anchorage and the Mat-Su Valley this afternoon will slowly transition over to snow overnight tonight as temperatures in the lower atmosphere slowly cool. Snow accumulation could be closer to a few inches through Monday morning if the transition over to snow happens earlier than currently anticipated.
info.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
Be prepared for slippery roads. Slow down and use caution while traveling. If you are going outside, watch your first few steps taken on stairs, sidewalks, and driveways. These surfaces could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.

parameter.value: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST MONDAY

area.areaDesc: Anchorage; Lower Matanuska Valley; Southern Susitna Valley
